TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ExpandableListView extends Android.Widget.ListView

Docs.summary: A view that shows items in a vertically scrolling two-level list.

remarks.para: A view that shows items in a vertically scrolling two-level list. This differs from the by allowing two levels: groups which can individually be expanded to show its children. The items come from the associated with this view.

Expandable lists are able to show an indicator beside each item to display the item's current state (the states are usually one of expanded group, collapsed group, child, or last child). Use or (or the corresponding XML attributes) to set these indicators (see the docs for each method to see additional state that each Drawable can have). The default style for an provides indicators which will be shown next to Views given to the . The layouts android.R.layout.simple_expandable_list_item_1 and android.R.layout.simple_expandable_list_item_2 (which should be used with ) contain the preferred position information for indicators.
The context menu information set by an will be a object with being a packed position that can be used with and the other similar methods.

Note:
You cannot use the value wrap_content for the android:layout_height attribute of a ExpandableListView in XML if the parent's size is also not strictly specified (for example, if the parent were ScrollView you could not specify wrap_content since it also can be any length. However, you can use wrap_content if the ExpandableListView parent has a specific size, such as 100 pixels.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 GetExpandableListPosition(int32 flatListPosition) cil managed

Docs.param: The flat list position to be converted.
Docs.summary: Converts a flat list position (the raw position of an item (child or group) in the list) to a group and/or child position (represented in a packed position).

remarks.para: Converts a flat list position (the raw position of an item (child or group) in the list) to a group and/or child position (represented in a packed position). This is useful in situations where the caller needs to use the underlying 's methods. Use , , to unpack.

MemberSignature.Value: public static long GetPackedPositionForChild (int groupPosition, int childPosition);
.method public static hidebysig int64 GetPackedPositionForChild(int32 groupPosition, int32 childPosition) cil managed

Docs.param: The child's parent group's position.
The child position within the group.
Docs.summary: Returns the packed position representation of a child's position.

remarks.para: Returns the packed position representation of a child's position.

In general, a packed position should be used in situations where the position given to/returned from an or method can either be a child or group. The two positions are packed into a single long which can be unpacked using , , and .

Docs.summary: The value for a packed position that represents neither/null/no preference.

remarks.para: The value for a packed position that represents neither/null/no preference. This value is not otherwise possible since a group type (first bit 0) should not have a child position filled.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool SetSelectedChild (int groupPosition, int childPosition, bool shouldExpandGroup);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool SetSelectedChild(int32 groupPosition, int32 childPosition, bool shouldExpandGroup) cil managed

Docs.param: The position of the group that contains the child.
The position of the child within the group.
Whether the child's group should be expanded if it is collapsed.
Docs.summary: Sets the selection to the specified child.

remarks.para: Sets the selection to the specified child. If the child is in a collapsed group, the group will only be expanded and child subsequently selected if shouldExpandGroup is set to true, otherwise the method will return false.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
